What about offer the possibility to click / tap on the video / picture of the participant and then show some kind of slider (which doesnâ€™t have to be too fine-grained)? That would be frickinâ€™ useful.

posts.name: taza
posts.cooked:
an option in which i can mute devices(even my own if i have joined from devices) in a group call or by lowering their volume to zero.

392Ã—568 19.3 KB

Something akin to how discord does it. I think these are essential features for people to be able to switch from discord to signal for tinier groups. There can often be big differences between the loudness of peopleâ€™s microphones, so itâ€™d be nice if we had the option to change it to our liking. Also, mute them if theyâ€™re away and we only hear their background noise. Weâ€™re also still missing a sound on the desktop app for when someone joins a group call. One last thing would be the ability to turn off the lowering of the volume of all other applications that signal does when youâ€™re in a group chat on a desktop.

posts.name: Dan Turner
posts.cooked: Iâ€™ve heard multiple users fussing about not having this functionality (all coming from discord) . Signal does a pretty good job balancing these levels but it isnâ€™t always perfect, and when the levels arenâ€™t right, itâ€™s frustrating that there isnâ€™t anything that can be configured to fix the situation. It can make large calls difficult to manage.

Iâ€™d also love for this to be added. Not just in group calls, but one-on-one as well. Itâ€™s so useful for a wide variety of use cases. I often end up using Discord instead of Signal (for specific use cases) because we canâ€™t control each otherâ€™s audio output levels on Signal.

MichaelNelson:

Not just in group calls, but one-on-one as well.

In a one on one call you just turn down the call volume. This feature only makes sense in a group call with 3+ participants.

Yet there are situations where it makes sense to also enable it in one-on-one scenarios.

  1. If adding the feature for group calls, why not just enable it for all calls?
  2. If implemented similarly to the way Discord does it, it remembers the value you set, so the caller doesnâ€™t blow out your eardrums the next time you talk.
  3. Iâ€™d prefer to not fiddle with master volume every time I talk with someone. Plus, sometimes, changing the master volume also affects the volume of media when watching / listening to something while on the call. Yes, you can control each individually (depending on the OS?), but itâ€™s much simpler to just temporarily:
    A. Deafen yourself in the call, or
    B. Mute / lower the other personâ€™s output

Lastly, thereâ€™s nothing wrong with adding flexibility. Especially if some of these nice-to-have features are things people will be missing from the platforms they use/d the most.

MichaelNelson:

If implemented similarly to the way Discord does it, it remembers the value you set

Okay, thatâ€™s a specific feature that hasnâ€™t been mentioned here. Saving a volume level for each user would be something that would make it meaningful in one on one calls.

MichaelNelson:

Iâ€™d prefer to not fiddle with master volume every time I talk with someone. Plus, sometimes, changing the master volume also affects the volume of media when watching / listening to something while on the call

On Android, call audio has its own volume, so it doesnâ€™t affect media.

MichaelNelson:

Iâ€™d prefer to not fiddle with master volume every time I talk with someone.

On a 1:1 call I think I rather use the volume buttons on my phone rather than having to go to the UI to move a slider

TomatoPlant:

On a 1:1 call I think I rather use the volume buttons on my phone rather than having to go to the UI to move a slider

Thatâ€™s fair. It would be nice to have the option to do what works for us.

I did my first group call yesterday and it was the first thing we noticed. I tend to be much louder than my friends, so naturally, my voice was drowning out the other user.

I adjusted my volume a bit to try and compensate, but this should really be something the others could set to balance when the software isnâ€™t doing a perfect job.

I feel like individual volumes in calls (groups or otherwise) should be implemented because I believe it is an important component to voice communication software. It becomes more and more important as you add more people to a group, but it is still important in small gatherings like the 3 people I had yesterday.

Please consider working on this feature!

Cheers,
FIGBird

It would be great if you could mute or as a more general feature be able to control the volume of individual participants in a voice or video call.
For example when I am in the some room with someone else and we both join the same group call I want to mute them because I dont want to hear them doubled with delay in the room and in the call.
Also changing the volume is a nice feature when people use different microphones and are not at the same sound level.
